post.body: IF you need some stories, www.digyourjob.com contains nearly 60 stories that relate career advice from their dads, funny, good
Nah, how could that be for a creative genius like YOU.
You are very welcome. Sort of a hidden secret out there, isn't it? www.linkup.com and don't forget www.digyourjob.com, too.
try jibberjobber. OR Jobtracker. find un advertised jobs at linkup.com. read www.digyourjob.com for more.
Last chapter in newly released book, www.digyourjob.com, has entire last chapter about dad's career advice from 58 people.
Good morning Sarah and all, from scenic Minneapolis, where we are having a heat wave..six degrees this AM, seems balmy.
try www.linkup.com...only un advertised jobs directly from company's own website.
Question would be to Big 3, is this a bridge or a pier. Sounds like a pier. read seth godins post of two weeks back, great.
Direct him or her to linkup.com, a website unlike any other. Only unadvertised jobs ONLY from company websites. good luck
thanks Mike...great blog post!!
well, I love my Iphone. seriously.
what does that mean Jim? Have not updated mine for a few days. Is posting the same as updating. Thanks for answer.
it does seem like a lot of people are simply shouting out their blog posts and other links. I like the discipline of 140 tho.
I cant do without my iphone.
Well timed conrad...at Christmas time when all of us either saw old Grandpa or wish we could.
oh man me too. THat is when i explore all the iphone apps.
Hmmm no. Wait, yes they hit your email, at least mine do.
Only good place because it only has jobs from company websites. www.linkup.com, pass it along if you like what you find. thanks.
send him to www.whatwoulddadsay.com, invite him to comment and contribute. I am sure he can offer up a lot, am i right or what?
HEY JT...Merry Christmas Girl. Missing our emails, you must be out helping a lot of people these days. Good, they need it.
Wassup with tipping the Starbucks kid and not the one at McDonald's. Not fair, I say.
Yesterday Mike Street at greasyguide.com reviews DIGYOURJOB. Tagline: Your Online destination for Urban Information. All cuz twitter.
RT @chrisdenney: @GLHoffman I'm lovin Linkup. Also like the LinkenIn integration...Thanks!
? of the day: If you were Mr Button in Brad Pitt's new movie, would you want to be younger or older? For some of us, ezy-pzy this one.
Un advertised jobs are located at www.linkup.com. Only jobs directly from company websites, no job boards, scam, third party, etc. passiton
Must learn to edit my tone more as the commenters suggest; but still: ouch, http://tinyurl.com/5hdgko
Funniest line of the week goes to ConHake who said a friend of his twitters, but he uses morse code, with a flashlight. So descriptive.
Bernard Madoff et all are pissing me off http://tinyurl.com/5udxye
Bernard Madoff: Big Whoop, posted over at USNEWS,http://tinyurl.com/5hdgko what to do/what to do--ideas for all
RT @MNHeadhunter: GL Hoffman of JobDig is on Twitter @GLHoffman and has a new book out called Dig Your Job http://cli.gs/PSuE0S
Is it time to short sports stars and entertainers. See post at http://blogs.jobdig.com/wwds/
Anyone know why Wii is so hard to get? Purposeful? Why bring content to it? Just spent the morning calling for wii fit. Grrrr, make more?
"'Nother way around the barn," is a way to describe the attitude of upwardly mobile managers when confronted with some stumbling block ahead
DIGYOURJOB tip: Can you 'see' work? Company owners I talk with constantly mention this as a characteristic they wish they could determine.
off to the Mall of America now. Lucky me, I have KINDLE. Biggest complaint about Nordstroms: not enough chairs.
Me to little kids at christmas: "Do your mommy and daddy still argue like they used to?" Hilarious responses. Watch Mom and Dad muzzle them
Time to short over paid athletes and entertainers? It happened to investment bankers and CEO's. No loyalty and $100+ seats will cause it.
Reminder from xmas. Tell your mom and dad more about your workplace. I know they want to hear about it, and just maybe they can help, mybe
Miss old times, like when we would hide gallons of red anti freeze in snow drifts, and when the snow removal trucks would swope by, run.
Thinking about going ice fishing today. Really? No, not really. I mean really not really.
